name: Straight Bar Cable Curls
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a cable machine with the bar at chest height and standing in front of you.

2. Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart, keeping your elbows close to your body.

3. Extend your arms straight out, engaging your core and keeping your back straight.

4. Curl the bar up towards your shoulders by flexing your biceps.

5. Focus on using only your biceps to lift the weight. Avoid swinging or jerking the bar.

6. Lower the bar back down to the starting position by extending your arms fully.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and engaging your core throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Straight bar cable curls are an effective isolation exercise that target the biceps, strengthening them while minimizing involvement from other upper body muscles.
equipment_used: Cable machine with straight bar attachment
